author: abcoathup
content:
Regarding POAPs for GitHub contributions, is it a technical barrier (not enough info to prove contribution) or an implementation barrier (POAP don't support GitHub allow list)?

If it is the second, I wonder if this is something GitPOAP could do.

What percentage of the 141k contributions were via GitHub?

author: roadia.eth
content: <@550420431744794624> Ser thanks for helping me, i actually responded to you in your DM and found the issue. i'd be grateful if you could help me resolve.

author: ahamed_
content: Sir.. i hav  done ceremony task using github.. plz can u guide me how to claim poap

author: robocopsgonemad
content: for those inquiring about POAPs for those who logged in with GitHub for their contributions, please see the ceremony faq here: https://ceremony.ethereum.org/#/

author: robocopsgonemad
content: the section `Why do I need to sign in with Ethereum or GitHub?` explains why POAPs require login with ETH Address

author: ahamed_
content: @jus to my understading.. if u have done through github . U cant claim poap . Itz only for ppl done through etherum  wallet adress  as per the link you hav shown.. correct me sir if i m wrong

author: carlbeek
content: Yes <@827653956955406406> is correct, the POAPs are tied to the Ethereum address that did the contribution. It is not possible to issue a POAP to the GitHub contributors

author: ahamed_
content: Ty sir for clarification....

author: trent_vanepps
content:
it may be possible? 

we did not consider it for the sake of simplicity, but even if we had the POAP checkout product only supports address whitelists at this time

author: abcoathup
content:
I assume you will see a lot of requests for a POAP for GitHub contributors.

The transcript has a GitHub username, shame that POAP checkout doesn't support GitHub allow listing.  Maybe GitPOAP might be able could do it.
